sentences.sContent: When Hogan first realised this, he wondered if any experiment might be able to detect the holographic blurriness of space-time.
sentences.sContent_eng: When Hogan first realised this, he wondered if any experiment might be able to detect the holographic blurriness of space-time.
sentences.sCn: 当霍根第一次意识到这一点时，他急欲知道是否有实验能够探测时空的全息模糊度。

sentences.sContent: No one knows what it would mean for us if we really do live in a hologram, yet theorists have good reasons to believe that many aspects of the holographic principle are true.
sentences.sContent_eng: No one knows what it would mean for us if we really do live in a hologram, yet theorists have good reasons to believe that many aspects of the holographic principle are true.
sentences.sCn: 如果我们确实生活在一张全息图中，没人知道这对我们究竟意味着什么。 但理论学家有很好的理由相信全息原理的很多方面是真实的。

words.tran: [激光] 全息图；全息摄影，全息照相
全息术；全息摄影；[摄][激光] 全息照相术

trans.tranOther: of, relating to, or produced using holograms; three-dimensional
